intro: Hesperantha secunda, commonly known as the Cape bell or blue bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Hesperantha secunda has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
